body_html: Unresponsive to CTRL+C is suspicious. Is it possible to kill it using kill? I've seen unkillable TF training caused by 1) stuck IO (ie, trying to write to NFS when net is down) 2) Nvidia driver (it gets stuck sometimes). Both can be troubleshooted by looking at the stuck call in /proc/<pid>/stack.
body_text: Unresponsive to CTRL+C is suspicious. Is it possible to kill it using kill? Both can be troubleshooted by looking at the stuck call in /proc/<pid>/stack.
body: Unresponsive to CTRL+C is suspicious. Is it possible to kill it using `kill`? I've seen unkillable TF training caused by 1) stuck IO (ie, trying to write to NFS when net is down) 2) Nvidia driver (it gets stuck sometimes). Both can be troubleshooted by looking at the stuck call in `/proc/<pid>/stack`.
